intro: Dalzellia angustissima, commonly known as the narrowleaf dalzellia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Dalzellia angustissima is often found in moist, wooded areas and is valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
